data_manager module

class data_manager.DataManager[source]

Bases: object

Class to manage the data.

add_candidate(coordinates: tuple[float, float], label=None, color=None) → bool[source]

Adds a candidate to the data.

Parameters:

  • coordinates – candidate’s coordinates

  • label – candidate’s label

  • color – candidate’s color

Returns:

whether the candidate has been added or not

add_voter(coordinates: tuple[float, float]) → bool[source]

Adds a voter to the data.

Parameters:

coordinates – voter’s coordinates

Returns:

whether the voter has been added or not

clear_candidates()[source]

Clears all candidates.

clear_voters()[source]

Clears all voters.

edit_candidate_at(index: int, label: str, color: str) → bool[source]

Modifies the candidate label and color at the given index.

Parameters:

  • index – index of the desired candidate

  • label – candidate’s new label

  • color – candidate’s new color

Returns:

if the candidate was edited successfully or not

edit_voter_at(index: int, label: str) → bool[source]

Modifies the voter label at the given index.

Parameters:

  • index – index of the desired voter

  • label – voter’s new label

Returns:

if the voter was edited successfully or not

get_candidate_at(index: int) → Candidate[source]

Returns the candidate at the given index.

Parameters:

index – index of the desired candidate

Returns:

candidate at given index

get_candidates() → list[candidate.Candidate][source]

Returns the list of candidates.

Returns:

list of candidates in data

get_voter_at(index: int) → Voter[source]

Returns the voter at the given index.

Parameters:

index – index of the desired voter

Returns:

voter at given index

get_voters() → list[voter.Voter][source]

Returns the list of voters.

Returns:

list of voters in data

is_candidates_empty() → bool[source]

Returns whether the list of candidates is empty or not. :return: bool(is list candidates empty?)

is_voters_empty() → bool[source]

Returns whether the list of voters is empty or not. :return: bool(is list voters empty?)

set_candidate_added_callback(callback: Callable[[Candidate, int], None])[source]

Sets the (on candidate added) callback, which is called when a candidate is added to the data.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function, takes a Candidate and their index in the data

set_candidate_edited_callback(callback: Callable[[Candidate, int], None])[source]

Sets the (on candidate edited) callback, which is called when a candidate is edited inside the data.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function, takes a Candidate and their index in the data

set_candidate_error_callback(callback: Callable[[str], None])[source]

Sets the (on candidate error) callback, which is called when an error occurs with a candidate.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function

set_candidates_cleared_callback(callback: Callable[[], None])[source]

Sets the (on candidates cleared) callback, which is called when all candidates are cleared from the data.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function

set_voter_added_callback(callback: Callable[[Voter, int], None])[source]

Sets the (on voter added) callback, which is called when a voter is added to the data.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function, takes a Voter and their index in the data

set_voter_edited_callback(callback: Callable[[Voter, int], None])[source]

Sets the (on voter edited) callback, which is called when a voter is edited inside the data.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function, takes a Voter and their index in the data

set_voter_error_callback(callback: Callable[[str], None])[source]

Sets the (on voter error) callback, which is called when an error occurs with a voter.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function

set_voters_cleared_callback(callback: Callable[[], None])[source]

Sets the (on voters cleared) callback, which is called when all voters are cleared from the data.

Parameters:

callback – the callback function
